title: T550 M.2 Slot Overview
speaker: Steven Ray Mann
text: how many m3 slots does a lenovo t550 have?

title: T550 M.2 Slot Overview
speaker: animaeon
text:
The ThinkPad T550 officially supports **three M.2 slots**, each serving different functions:

1. **M.2 2230 slot** — reserved for the WLAN (Wi‑Fi/Bluetooth) card.  
2. **M.2 2242 slot** — typically used for optional WWAN (LTE/3G), but can be repurposed for a 2242-sized SSD. citeturn0search1  
3. **M.2 2280 slot** — the primary SSD slot, supporting NVMe or SATA 2280 SSDs. citeturn0search0turn0search3

---

### 🧩 Summary

| Slot Type | Form Factor | Default Use | Expandability |
|-----------|-------------|-------------|----------------|
| M.2 2230  | WLAN        | Wi‑Fi/BT    | No (dedicated) |
| M.2 2242  | SSD/WWAN    | WWAN        | Yes (SSD)      |
| M.2 2280  | SSD         | Primary SSD | Yes (SSD)      |

---

### ✅ Practical Insight  
You can absolutely install two SSDs: one in the primary 2280 slot for your OS/applications, and optionally another 2242 SSD in place of the WWAN card. That gives you dual-device storage in addition to the standard 2.5″ drive bay.

Let me know if you want help picking compatible SSDs or assistance upgrading!

title: T550 M.2 Slot Overview
speaker: animaeon
text: You're welcome! 😎 The T550 is surprisingly versatile for its age. If you ever want help maxing it out—RAM, storage, even BIOS tuning—just holler.
